doc.field: Correspondence To and From HRL and Miss Thrasher
Correspondence To and From HRL and Miss Thrasher

Includes a memo from D. W. Brumbaugh titled "Fortune Division Allocations of Corporate Expense and Profit Sharing," a memo from Grover dealing with the problems of ARCHITECTURAL FORUM, a carbon copy of a memo from Roy Larsen on a telephone call he had with HRL, a typescript copy of a letter from Mac Ingersoll to HRL regarding the subject of management vs. group management, a memo from Grover regarding profit sharing, a memo regarding Time Inc.'s legal problem, and background information on the Women's National Institute. Correspondents include Paul Felix Warburg and Richard de Rochemont.
Series VI. Allen Grover Files >> Correspondence To and From HRL and Miss Thrasher
